subject: RE: [junit] Is there a tool which generates JUnit-test stubs?
msgSnippet: JBuilder 6 Enterprise Edition has JUnit wizards. They seem like they would be helpful to those very new to JUnit, but after you get a few tests working, just
messageBody:
JBuilder 6 Enterprise Edition has JUnit wizards. They seem like they would be helpful to those very new to JUnit, but after you get a few tests working, just recycle those.

Simon

-----------------------------------------------------------------
Simon P. Chappell simon.chappell@...
Java Programming Specialist www.landsend.com
Lands' End, Inc. (608) 935-4526


>-----Original Message-----
>From: markus baumgartner [mailto:mbg@...]
>Sent: Friday, March 15, 2002 10:14 AM
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [junit] Is there a tool which generates JUnit-test stubs?
>
>
>
>I'm spending a lot of time passing new method into the
>testclass and write a
>"test_" in front of it (and oftenly forget to do it, too).
>I made a try to automate the creation of stubs for all
>existing methods of a
>class using the Reflection API (e.g. from myProcedure(int A,
>String B) to
>test_myProcedure_int_A_String_B. The final goal would be to
>have the tool
>comparing the class to the test_class and create stubs for new methods
>while leaving the existing ones untouched.
>
>Before I'm going to create it on my own, I wanted to know, if
>anybody knows
>about an existing tool, that does the job?
>
>If it does not exist, is there a good reason, why this
>automation wouldn't
>make sense? Sometimes for complex function you may need
>several testcases,
>but they can be easely created by taking the first stub and append a
>number...
>
>
>
>
